question:
You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the generated code is executable for demonstration purposes.
 
Please help me implement the following request using SVG code. The requirement is to create a bow, which is a hunting weapon used for shooting arrows.

checklist.title: Is the basic bow structure correctly implemented in SVG?
checklist.description: Review whether the SVG code accurately renders the fundamental structure of a bow with proper curvature. The bow should include a curved limb structure (upper and lower limbs), bowstring, grip/handle section, and proper proportions. Score 0 if the basic bow shape is missing, 5 if only a simplistic representation is provided, and 10 if the bow includes detailed anatomical components.

checklist.title: Does the implementation include proper bowstring representation?
checklist.description: Check whether the bowstring is properly represented with appropriate tension and attachment points to the limb tips. The string should appear taut and positioned correctly in relation to the bow's curve. Deduct 5 points if the string is missing or incorrectly positioned, and 3 points if the string-to-limb connection is unrealistic. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the bow's grip/handle area detailed and anatomically correct?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the grip/handle section is properly detailed with ergonomic design elements including a riser, arrow rest, and grip contours. A quality implementation should differentiate the handle material or color from the limbs. Deduct 3 points if the grip lacks detail, 5 points if the grip is anatomically incorrect, and 8 points if the grip is missing entirely. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are visual enhancements such as textures or decorative elements included?
checklist.description: Examine if the bow includes visual enhancements such as wood grain textures, decorative patterns, binding wraps, or other aesthetic elements that add realism without compromising the SVG performance. Score 0 if no visual enhancements are present, 5 for basic textures, and 10 for detailed and performance-optimized enhancements.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle display across different viewports, includes proper SVG namespace declarations, and uses appropriate SVG element attributes. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively scale without distortion and render consistently across browsers. Give 10 points for highly robust code with viewBox, preserveAspectRatio and fallbacks. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if critical SVG attributes are missing, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Animation showing bow flexing 2. Interactive elements allowing users to draw the bow 3. Visual effects like shadows or highlights that add dimensionality). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Duplicate SVG elements that serve the same purpose 2. Excessive nested groups (<g>) without clear organization 3. Over-complicated path definitions that could be simplified. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core rendering is affected by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review the SVG structure (such as proper grouping of elements), use of reusable components (like symbols or gradients), and code readability. Deduct 5 points if elements are not logically grouped; deduct 5 points if there's excessive coordinate hardcoding without variables or calculation; deduct 5 points if comments or meaningful IDs are missing. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the visual design meet professional standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Balanced proportions between bow parts 2) Appropriate use of color and contrast 3) Clean lines and smooth curves without jagged edges. Deduct 3 points for each disproportion in visual elements, 5 points for poor color choices that affect visibility, and 5 points for jagged or visually disrupting path definitions. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the SVG optimized for performance?
checklist.description: Judge whether the SVG implementation is efficiently coded: 1) Appropriate use of path commands with minimal points 2) Proper use of transform attributes instead of duplicate elements 3) Efficient use of gradients and filters without unnecessary complexity. Deduct 3 points for each unnecessarily complex path, 5 points for excessive DOM elements that could be combined, and 5 points for unoptimized filter effects that impact rendering. The full score is 10 points.
